contentrichtext.text: '''Baron Kenswood''', of St Marylebone in the County of London, is a title in the [[Peerage of the United Kingdom]]. It was created in 1951 for the professional violinist and welfare worker for the blind, [[Ernest Whitfield, 1st Baron Kenswood|Ernest Whitfield]]. {{As of|2010}} the title is held by his only son, the second Baron, who succeeded in 1963. ==Barons Kenswood (1951)== *[[Ernest Whitfield, 1st Baron Kenswood|Ernest Albert Whitfield, 1st Baron Kenswood]] (1887â€“1963) *John Michael Howard Whitfield, 2nd Baron Kenswood (b. 1930) ==Notes== {{unreferenced|date=February 2013}} {{reflist}} ==References== *Kidd, Charles, Williamson, David (editors). ''Debrett's Peerage and Baronetage'' (1990 edition). New York: St Martin's Press, 1990, {{Page needed |date=February 2013}} *{{Rayment|date=February 2012}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kenswood}} [[Category:Baronies in the Peerage of the United Kingdom]]
